    Author:
    lxybi_000

      TimeAdapter() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String addOneDay(java.lang.String dbDateForm)
      Return the string format of date(stored in database format) plus one dbDateForm has to be the format of "YYYY_MM_DD", which is used to query the database and the returned date which is one day bigger is in the same format
      Date getDateFromUI(java.lang.String uiDate)
      Return the date according to the user input from the UI User has to follow the input rules(specified by the placeholder of input field) to enter a valid date format, if the user does not meet the preconditions of input rules, a new NumberFormatException is thrown
      Time getLocalTime(Time gmtTime, int offset)
      Return the local time given the GMT time and its offset The returned time should be a new Time instance that should never change the original GMT time instance, which is used among the multi-legs union
      int getTimezoneOffset(double lat, double longt)
      Return the offset of a location/Airport with known latitude and longitude Append latitude and longitude as URL parameter to http://www.earthtools.org/timezone/latitude/longitude and query for the offset of the airport using its longitude and latitude information

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public TimeAdapter()

    • Method Detail

      • addOneDay

        public java.lang.String addOneDay(java.lang.String dbDateForm)
        Return the string format of date(stored in database format) plus one dbDateForm has to be the format of "YYYY_MM_DD", which is used to query the database and the returned date which is one day bigger is in the same format
        Parameters:
        dbDateQueryForm: - Query parameter used to query database store in the format of: 2015_05_10
        Returns:
        String representation in same format(day added by one)

      • getDateFromUI

        public Date getDateFromUI(java.lang.String uiDate)
                   throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                          DateOutOfRangeException
        Return the date according to the user input from the UI User has to follow the input rules(specified by the placeholder of input field) to enter a valid date format, if the user does not meet the preconditions of input rules, a new NumberFormatException is thrown
        Parameters:
        uiDate - the date in String format specified by the user
        Returns:
        the date according to the user input
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - the given string cannot be parsed
        DateOutOfRangeException

      • getTimezoneOffset

        public int getTimezoneOffset(double lat,
                             double longt)
        Return the offset of a location/Airport with known latitude and longitude Append latitude and longitude as URL parameter to http://www.earthtools.org/timezone/latitude/longitude and query for the offset of the airport using its longitude and latitude information
        Parameters:
        airport - used to set the TimeZone
        Returns:
        the time zone offset used to convert GMT time to Local

      • getLocalTime

        public Time getLocalTime(Time gmtTime,
                         int offset)
        Return the local time given the GMT time and its offset The returned time should be a new Time instance that should never change the original GMT time instance, which is used among the multi-legs union
        Parameters:
        gmtTime - of the flight legs retrieved from the database
        offset - of the given departure/arrival airport of the flight leg
        Returns:
